result.execSummary:
Richard O Loureiro was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Richard O Loureiro was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard O Loureiro

records.addlTxt: 03:44 PM Defendant Richard O Loureiro not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court Defendant is not in the custody of the Waukesha County Jail and moves for case to be dismissed.  Court orders case dismissed.
Defendant Picked up by Boone County, IL on 06/30/22
notice of hearing returned from the jail
For Commitment, signed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on June 16, 2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard O Loureiro
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: 411 Haskins St, Lake Geneva, WI 53147
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Signed by the Court, DA and defendant in Court on June 16, 2022.

01:18 PM Defendant Richard O Loureiro in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint and accompanying affidavit with warrant from the State of Illinois and waives reading of complaint and affidavit.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant wishes to waives the extradition.  Court takes recess at 1:23 pm so the District Attorney's office may provide the waiver paperwork.  Case recalled at 1:35 pm with the same appearances.  Court Conducts Waiver of Extradition Colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant waives his right to extradition and the Court accepts the waiver of extradition.  Parties and the court sign the waiver of extradition.  Court Commissioner signed the Order for Commitment.  State Illinois is to be notified ASAP that the defendant is available for pick up.  Court sets a review hearing to ensure defendant was picked up by the State of Illinois.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
